messages.content: nokia and t-mobile really teamed up well on this baby .
service is great as far as i can tell , features work like a charm , ringtones are high quality if you buy them from t-mobile and aim is great .
this is probably your best bet if you are looking for a phone in this price range , or like me , do not have the patience to deal with annoying flip phones .
1 month , no problems , great phone i 'm very pleased with my 6610 phone .
the speakerphone works better than any speakerphone i 've ever had .
the sound quality is excellent , except , maybe a * tad * too quiet at times when there are quieter talkers on the other end of the line .
the included earpiece is very comfortable and easy to use .
i have not had any distortion problems with this phone and am more pleased with this phone than any i 've used before .
first let me say that it is much smaller than it looks on the web and it also looks better .
the radio feature has superb sound quality .
it has a classic design yet looks hip .
it is extremely light and disappears in your pocket .
the battery is alot better than most of the phones out there .
this phone is great as a whole and is not like others with one or two good qualities .
it does well in all aspects of internet browsing .
battery life is good for a phone of this size .
but anyway , the only thing you should really look at here is the fact that the phone does have voice dialing .
the 6610 excels as a cell phone , thank god .
the voice quality is very good , and it gets great reception ( that is , in places where you get t-mobile coverage , which is not that good ; . see below ) .
the color screen makes this free-after-rebates phone shine bright , and commands are very responsive .
other than that , this is a perfect phone for those of us with no patience for flips .
the nokia 6610 is a relatively new phone , and what a great phone it is .
after using it , i found the size to be perfect for carrying in a pocket .
it is just a tad small to hold to your ear with your shoulder , but that is solved with the very comfortable handsfree ear-piece which is included .
when i turned the phone on , the first thing that hit me is how good the screen is .
the resolution is very good and the colors are bright and even changeable ! .
the ringtones included are awesome , and did i mention they were polyphonic ? .
you can also assign special rings and graphics to special people when they call .

the phone also sports an image gallery ( with option camera attachment ) , a calendar / organizer , alarm clock with snooze , fm radio ( way cool , even if it is just through an ear-peice ) , games , java applications and gprs high-speed internet connection .
all my questions or problems have been quickly and satisfactorily resolved .
the rate plans are also very good , at least for me .
this phone is highly recommended otherwise .
nokia makes a great phone , that 's clear .
with all its complicated features , the menus are easily accessible and the quality of the features is great .
this phone is good with a huge array of features built into it .
the design is sleek and the color screen has good resolution .
it is very light weight and has a good signal strength .
but , i would definately recommend this phone .
this is one of the nicest phones nokia has made .
sound quality : the ipod 's sound quality is pretty good .
the bass is deep and the treble is clear .
ease of use/design : the ipod is a very easy to use mp3 player , and if you can 't figure this out , you shouldn 't even own one .
the ipod is a fine cousin to the early macs and current offerings from jobs and company .
long live apple , long live macs , and long live the ipod ! .
i have an ipod and it is a great buy .
the software with the ipod includes itunes , which allows you to play the music on your computer , rip cds onto your computer , and move your music from the computer to the ipod .
this new click wheel ipod allows you to navigate through the menus and song via a touch-wheel for scrolling and click-able buttons for selection .
the song quality of the ipod is excellent , and the included ear buds are actually more than satisfactory , for most users .
battery life keeps improving on the ipod , and a new ipod will give you up to twelve hours of play time , per charge .
thank you apple ! . you make fabulous products .
the product i rate five stars ,
plus , if you order from amazon . com , they will exchange it for you no problem .
this one has a color display , which i like a lot , being very visual .
i loaded a lot of photos into it and they display very clearly for such a small screen and , very importantly , the transition from one photo to the next is instantaneous .
it comes with an adapter to plug into the wall , which i hear is a step up from the other ipods , which require you plug it into a computer to charge it .
pros : large hard drive for the $$ -- 20gb and 40gb are both affordable .
decently sized screen -- one of the larger ones on the market at 2 "
decent battery -- on the average size , but the 40gb comes with a dock .
firewire & usb2 . 0 -- for those fortunate enough to have firewire400 , your in for a real treat with auto sync .

great design -- very sleek and touch wheel has still never been successfully copied ( virtual ones are the only competition ) ; . and now the wheel clicks , taking away a lot of headaches from 3rd gen and very navigable in the menus .
good sound -- plays very nicely , even though the stock headphones are kind of weak durable -- not the most durable because its mostly plastic , but very compact and sturdy
games -- not really important , but exist ant
hold button -- suprisingly not all mp3s have this ; . this allows you to have all the buttons unusable , so that you don 't accidently hit something in your pocket .

. itunes -- this is a love-hate relationship program ; . usually people with mac like this program than people with a pc , but depending on your computer expertise , this could be a difficult program to use , and it is required for an ipod .
comments : overall this is still a great value , but is kind of overrated in the sense that there are beater deals on the market .

i had a casio unit , which had given great service , and would have been happy to get another one , but was tempted by the ipod 's sleek design , storage capacity , connection options- - firewire and usb , and its integration with itunes .
the controls and the menus are clearly displayed and easily fathomed
the ipod is a very nice product , which given reasonable care , should give a lot of service .
i have about 6 gb used on my ipod so far ( well over 1000 songs ) , and as far as i can tell , all of them play at near-cd quality .
other than the fact that one can 't delete a file directly from the ipod , the interface is excellent and mind-numbingly simple to use .
as for itunes , i don 't find it to be as good as the windows media player as a computer mp3 player , but it is good enough .
in conclusion , i gave the ipod a 4/5 because anything this expensive should would work just about flawlessly .
everything i wanted ! . the apple ipod has become one of the most sought-after electronic gadgets - and for good reason .
its sleek design , large memory capacity , compatibility with itunes , and ease of use makes this one of the best portable digital listening devices on the market .
unless you have an enormous music/audio book library , the 20 gb model should have more than adequate storage capacity , with a stated ability to hold 5000 songs .

features : click wheel to navigate ; . ability to work with windows or mac ; . optional back lighting ( you can have it on all the time , or have it shut off to save battery power after 5 , 10 , or 20 seconds ) ; . ability to download pda info ; . automatic or manual download from itunes when ipod is plugged into your computer .
there 's even an equalizer ( under " settings " ) that allows you to adjust the sound for acoustic , bass booster , bass reducer , classical , dance , " deep " , and electronic .

with accessories , you can make the ipod into a digital recorder , broadcast it remotely through stereo speakers using wireless technology , and play it through your car speakers using either a cd adaptor or fm stereo broadcaster .
itunes can be downloaded from the enclosed cd or for free from the apple site .
all in all , this is a wonderful device .
apple has definately fulfilled its reputation in making quality equipment , and surprisingly wasn 't as expensive as its reputation normally holds .
finally , compare the ipod to other players on a cost/gb , and also consider ease of use .
the ipod is not overpriced compared to the market .
this is the best purchase i 've made in a very long time .
the sound is incredible ; . very clean , very wide dynamic range of bass , midas and highs , and can be very loud if i turn it up full blast .
the sound quality is excellent , accessing the music is easy , and the controls are generally well thought out .

i still give the ipod five stars , though , as it could have been something i did incorrectly during the install ( though i did follow the onscreen prompts ) so i 'll give apple the benefit of the doubt .
the battery holds a charge for a very long time ( maybe 15 or so hours of use ) so realistically there are no real range or endurance issues associated with ipod use .

( it sure does look nice , though ! . ) i recommend this to any music lover anywhere : the quality of the audio is excellent , the controls and indicators rapidly become intuitive , and the storage capacity and battery life are huge ! .

using the software itunes is relatively simple , you just plug the usb cable in , wait your machine to detect the ipod and voila , any songs listed in your itunes library will be transfer ed on over to the ipod .
and , with the ipods ' full volume up , all you have to do is adjust your receivers ' volume and your set , since the ipod itself acts as a strong amp lifer of its ' own .
however after purchasing a 20 gb ipod it 's clear to see the superiority .
for a sleeker , smaller and more " average " mp3 player the nitrus is great but the ipod blows it out of the water - the interface is great and the design is wonderful .
the actual experience of using the ipod is magnificent .
the design , as mentioned above , is sleek , cool and trendy ( and i think trendy = good , but it 's always hard to tell these days ) .

the battery life last es 12 hours , and charges quickly . ( as mentioned above , the initial charge is a minimum of only two hours - not too long at all ! . ) once you 've downloaded your music , you can access the tracks by artist , genre , album , composer ( this comes in handy when the actual composer is different from the artist - e . g . covers of songs ) , etc .
the included earphones are pretty good - my advice ? .
the ease of use of the ipod is a major attribute .
with the ipod , you can also store documents and contact files ( from programs such as microsoft outlook ) when it 's connected to your pc as an external hard drive .
also included in the " games " section is the great music trivia option - which tests your skill at being able to quickly place your own songs .
20 gb or 40 gb ? . the pros of the 40 gb : comes with a " dock station " and double storage space ( 10 , 000 songs ) .
overall the ipod really is an almost flawless beast . the capacity in the 20 gb is more than i think most people would ever need and , for the price , i highly recommend it .
everything else about the ipod is great , the click wheel is very easy to use and so is the software that comes with it .
finding all the albums , songs etc is much easier than you would think it would be even if you have 20 gig ( well 18 gig ) worth of music .
you can even use the ipod to store files from your pc and export your outlook files to it .
so reliability is the winner here for the ipod .
for looks , well ipod is head and shoulders better , both the iriver and creative zen look positively ugly when next to a gleaming ipod .

the ipod package comes with everything you need , the ac adaptor , firewire cable ( quicker than usb , but slower than usb 2 which it also gives ) , those snazzy and power full headphones , and of course the player .
these issues aside , the ipod is kind of like the cell phone in that once you have one , you can 't be without one .
also , you have to use it with itunes - or they 'll sue , dammit ! . but itunes is about as good as anything .
all the " cool " features of the mini , but with 20gb instead of 5 .
has the click wheel and the ability to scan through thousands of songs and organizes them great .
they fix the problem and help you with whatever your i-pod needs comes with two usb ports and a charger .
they are extremely convent and you don 't have to buy them seperately has i-tunes , which provides quality music at low prices .
the i-pod is the best thing i have ever used .
i found that to be the most impressive thing about the ipod 'mini ' - basically for ease of use , and the feel it gives .
this unit comes with the usb/firewire cable as a standard item now .
i have transferred in about 2 , 400 tracks so far - very easy to use both the ipod and itunes .
i was worried about what the sound quality would be like , but that seems to be just as good as the actual cd sound .
i love the features on the ipod and the many things you can do with it .
the arm band is fantastic and it doesn 't budge even at the gym .
i love the slim design ; . the weight would only be an issue if it were bulky .
the ear buds that come with it look cheap , but the sound quality is amazing .
the click wheel is incredibly convenient , however it can be a little overly touchy at times , which will make you frustrated with your own fingers .
i am a big fan of itunes , simply because it is terribly fast and convenient - if you are buying the songs from the itunes site .
i rarely get drawn in by mass-commercialism , but something about the ipod made me say , in the words of lou and andy , " i want that one ! . " i was willing to shell out
it can not be the computer or the owner , since i purchased mcgee anti-virus 8 and it installs and works fine with no problems .
nis 2003 worked like a charm last year .
the latest of internet security has antispam function that is helpful because i has received a mountain of those these days .
but that is good for me because symantec soft wares are a bit hard to master for me who are not savvy on computers .
i 'm not sure why all the bad reviews , my computer isn 't especially slowed down and i have win '98 .
sure , it slows it down a little , but that 's expected .
perhaps semantic could work out the efficiency a little , but these reviews are highly exaggerated . . . i would ask what else these people are running on their computers ( ? . )
this is the fourth version of systemworks and the second version of internet security that i have used and it has always been a favorite .
the antivirus feature is phenomenal , and is regularly updated .
i think their antivirus software was one of , if not the best , on the
once installed , however , some of the functions do work ok ( disk doctor , one button checkup , and win doctor ) .
these tasks are faster and easier than in prior versions , and i found the menu to be much more navigable .
their website had a download that helped remove those , although i had to manually remove a good number of files from the " programs " directory .
norton 's memory usage on systems with 512 mb is very low .
i just got an older 866 mhz system with 512 pc 133 ram and it also runs fine on that .
both the antivirus and firewall are integrated into one piece of software and they update together .
you won 't need to update your firewall and antivirus separately or install two disks .
the best part of the firewall is the visual backtracking .
we were able to obtain a norton corporate edition of antivirus only ( no firewall or utilities ) and so far it 's great .
i 've used the corporate edition at work without any problems ever .
by the way , i use the norton 2003 corporate at work with absolutely no trouble .
likewise , i 've heard norton 2004 professional version is fine too .
i 've been using nis 2004 for about 2 months and it works well .
norton pops up a window about the intrusions and gives me as much detail as possible about where the intrusion is coming from .
the pop up blocker and anti-spam are bonuses .
i didn 't have any major problems installing this software .
anyhow , this software is working fine and no problems since i installed it two weeks ago .
mine installed no problem ( but i did uninstall my norton anti-virus 2002 & personal firewall 2002 first ) .
this did manage to cut the number of pop ups during start-up from 4 down to 2 .
while it didn 't have all the features i would have liked , it was better than anything else i could find at the time .
also , with one click you can help train your spam killer .
and the firewall came with a wizard which made it effortless to configure it to my lan .

it 's a highly rated , kick ass firewall program that 's bundled with the venerable norton antivirus , plus extras ( like norton antispam & norton parental control ) that make this security suite a must-have for people who have broadband internet access .
luckily , with 3 rebates this product will cost me nothing ! . it is indeed worth nothing .
i 've tried the free versions of zone alarm and the free version of skate and they both have a nice and easy installation and work great ! . .
the only free help you get is in renewing your subscription ! .
the product has worked perfectly for me on my xp .
no more banner ads , pop-ups , and the reliable antivirus .
i work on word , explorer , netscape , acrobat reader , photoshop at same time ( meaning using a lot of memory ) , but still dont see a problem with computer ( getting slow or crashing ) .
this product is way cooler than anything ive used before ( pencilings and maccabees and norton antivirus alone ) .
all in all it hasn 't been a bad product .
i 've owned many norton products in my time , and for the most part , i 've been pleased with their performance .
this is also the case with nis 2004 .
i upgraded from nis 2003 , and the change in performance has not been noticeable .
on the contrary , i 'm quite pleased with my upgrade .
it works better and has more useful features than nis 2003 .
the program is fully featured , with much of what you 'd want from a security program --
the installation , set-up , and operating interfaces are well organized and intuitive and the email spam component works well .
pi ii 1ghz 512mb rd ram windows xp pro 80gb hd i was able to uninstall nis 2003 and install nis 2004 with no trouble .
i installed , activated and registered nis 2004 without issue .
so far , the anti-spam feature seems to be very good .
i downloaded a trial version of computer associates ex firewall and antivirus and fell in love with a computer security system all over again .
i did not have any of the installation problems that people highlighted here .
their products have been great and have saved my bacon on numerous occasions .
